p: Measles is seen in every country in the world and humans are the only natural host for wildtype measles virus, but monkeys may also be infected [ 8]. Without a vaccine, the epidemics of measles lasting 3 to 4 months could be predicted to occur every 2 to 5 years [ 9]. Annual measles outbreaks typically occur in late winter and early spring in temperate climates, influenced by both meteorological and social variables and by population density understood both in relation to the inhabited area and public places, such as schools [ 1, 9]. Countries in which the measles vaccine is widely used have experienced a marked decrease in the incidence of disease [ 10].
